page.title: 05WILDLIFE AROUND BRABOURNE
page.content: Recently a fox cub was seen trotting across a road with a chicken leg in its mouth.The fox cub was so surprised to have been seen that it dropped the chicken leg. The best time to go fox watching is in the evening.Some people do not just watch foxes however,as this area is visited every year by the East Kent Hunt! Badgers are also plentiful in this area and are fascinating to watch in the evenings.The young are very playful. There are many other animals,rabbits being plentiful,and also hares. Many wild flowers can be seen; orchids,cowslips,and many others which bend in with the beautiful countryside.
